content: this legal case involves two parties referred to as p and ob who are in a coownership dispute over a mercedes car the case started on october 29 2021 and lasted for 1 year and 4 months the final resolution was that the coownership was dissolved and the car was sold through a public auction with the proceeds being distributed proportionally between the parties the decision was based on a property act that stated the parties were involved in a dissolved marital union the plaintiff is claiming equal division of assets acquired during the marriage including a house and two cars the defendant admits to jointly acquiring the real estate property and proposes an agreement to divide it but argues that the lawsuit is unnecessary and suggests mediation instead the defendant also filed a counterclaim for reimbursement of savings legal costs and household expenses as well as ownership of a professional grill the plaintiff disputes these claims and confirms ownership of the grill a partial judgment was issued based on the acknowledgment of the parties house with conflicting witness statements and bank data presented as evidence the court found the lawsuit justified and the counterclaim unfounded establishing the parties coownership of certain properties and dismissing the defendants request for mediation
